conclusion: Analyze forces due to charges +Q and -Q to find electric force at point B
Distance from point B to both M and N is equal to L
Electric force F1 exerted by charge +Q on small ball at point B is kQq/L^2
Electric force F2 exerted by charge -Q on small ball at point B is kQq/L^2
Forces F1 and F2 have same magnitude but different directions; F1 points towards M and F2 points towards N
Resultant force F can be found using vector addition with angle 120 degrees between F1 and F2
Resultant force F is kQq/L^2 using formula for resultant of two equal vectors with angle 120 degrees
Magnitude of electric force experienced by small ball at point B is kQq/L^2
